channel.title: Fourth Time Lucky
channel.description: Recent content on Fourth Time Lucky

item.title: Hello and Goodbye to Hey
item.description: I was invited to Basecamp’s Hey email beta on June 16, and finally got around to playing with it this week. I’m not seeing what the major upgrades are, particularly when (after a two-week trial) Basecamp are asking $99/year for Hey. The iOS client is neatly designed and has well-written copy. The introductory emails are sensibly put together. But, the highlighted workflow features are a minor rebranding of similar features commonly available on free email services.

item.title: IPv6 in 2020
item.description: Briefly looked into “how is IPv6 deployment going”.

item.title: LPG Explosion in Zhejiang Province
item.description: This is what happens when an LPG truck crashes into a factory. As of today (Sunday 14th), local media is reporting 19 deaths and 172 injuries.

item.title: Accidental Tech Podcast - Notes
item.description: I’ve been working through the back catalog of the Accidental Tech Podcast, a long-running technology show by Marco Arment, Casey Liss and John Siracusa.1 When I come across something notable I’ll add it below.

item.title: 99 Beers at the Great American Beer Festival 2019
item.description: Ashiyah and I visited this year’s Great American Beer Festival in Denver. It brings over 800 breweries and 4,000 beers to the US’s largest celebration of craft beer.

item.title: Brexit: Incompatible Plugs
item.description: I’m a sucker for KAL comics, and European political commentary, and electric industry references. This comic works for me.Â

item.title: Snow on Coast
item.description: My brother-in-law’s Bug, parked on the North coast of the Olympic Peninsula in Washington state on Thursday 7 and Friday 8th. Yes, it snows in WA. No, most drivers can’t handle it.
